pages.text: Maghriboselache mohamezanei comes from the Upper Devonian, with fossils found in the Thylacocephalan Layer Formation, Morocco. It is a small cladoselachid shark, growing up to 2.7 cm in length. Maghriboselache is most well known for being the first cladoselachid to have 3 dimensionally preserved skulls, from the jaws, braincase and endocranium.

The generic name derives from the Arabic word 'al Maghrib', to mean 'Morocco'; and the Greek word 'selachos', to mean 'cartilaginous fish'. The specific name derives from the full name of Moha Mezane, a French geologist and fossil hunter whom discovered the first fossils of Maghriboselache.
